meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing four pyrrole rings.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study tetrapyrroles to understand their structure and properties.
meanings.sent2: Heme and chlorophyll molecules contain tetrapyrroles.
meanings.sent3: The tetrapyrroles in the lab were having a party, bonding over their shared pyrrole rings.
meanings.sent4: The tetrapyrroles stood together like a strong fortress, each pyrrole ring adding to their collective strength.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the tetrapyrroles shimmered like tiny interconnected rings of power.

meanings.definition: Tetrapyrroles are essential components of heme and chlorophyll molecules.
meanings.sent1: Plants rely on tetrapyrroles for photosynthesis to occur.
meanings.sent2: The tetrapyrroles play a crucial role in the green color of leaves.
meanings.sent3: At the molecular party, the tetrapyrroles were the life of the gathering, dancing with heme and chlorophyll.
meanings.sent4: The tetrapyrroles in nature are like the building blocks of life, forming the basis of essential molecules.
meanings.sent5: In the plant kingdom, tetrapyrroles reign supreme, orchestrating the dance of photosynthesis.
